newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: C-C Amatil to give San Mig extra seat-paper.
newsitem.headline: C-C Amatil to give San Mig extra seat-paper.

text.p: Australian based soft drink bottler Coca Cola Amatil Ltd will concede Philippines' San Miguel Corp a fourth board seat, The Australian Financial Review newspaper reported on Monday.

"The concession -- a complete about face from C-C Amtail's publicly stated position in April that an extra board seat was not renegotiaable -- should allow the two companies to complete the share and asset swap by the end of next week," the Financial Review said.

The two beverage groups announced in April that C-C Amatil would acquire San Miguel's soft drink subsidiary in exchange for San Miguel taking a 25 percent stake in C-C Amatil. As part of the deal, San Miguel would gain three seats on the CC-Amatil board, which would be expanded from 12 to 15 members.
San Miguel's largest shareholder, the Presidential Commission on Good Government, later expressed reservations about the deal and called for increased board representation.
C-C Amatil, which is 33 percent owned by The Coca Cola Co, ruled out any increase at the time.
